verses.verse: Then answered<WH6030> Bildad<WH1085> the Shuhite,<WH7747> and said,<WH559>
How long<WH5704> <WH575> will it be ere ye make<WH7760> an end<WH7078> of words?<WH4405> mark,<WH995> and afterwards<WH310> we will speak.<WH1696>
Wherefore <WH4069> are we counted<WH2803> as beasts,<WH929> and reputed vile<WH2933> in your sight?<WH5869>
He teareth<WH2963> himself<WH5315> in his anger:<WH639> shall the earth<WH776> be forsaken<WH5800> for<WH4616> thee? and shall the rock<WH6697> be removed<WH6275> out of his place?<WH4480> <WH4725>
Yea, <WH1571> the light<WH216> of the wicked<WH7563> shall be put out,<WH1846> and the spark<WH7632> of his fire<WH784> shall not<WH3808> shine.<WH5050>
The light<WH216> shall be dark<WH2821> in his tabernacle,<WH168> and his candle<WH5216> shall be put out<WH1846> with<WH5921> him.
The steps<WH6806> of his strength<WH202> shall be straitened,<WH3334> and his own counsel<WH6098> shall cast him down.<WH7993>
For <WH3588> he is cast<WH7971> into a net<WH7568> by his own feet,<WH7272> and he walketh<WH1980> upon<WH5921> a snare.<WH7639>
The gin<WH6341> shall take<WH270> him by the heel,<WH6119> and the robber<WH6782> shall prevail<WH2388> against<WH5921> him.
The snare<WH2256> is laid<WH2934> for him in the ground,<WH776> and a trap<WH4434> for him in<WH5921> the way.<WH5410>
Terrors <WH1091> shall make him afraid<WH1204> on every side,<WH5439> and shall drive<WH6327> him to his feet.<WH7272>
His strength<WH202> shall be<WH1961> hunger-bitten,<WH7457> and destruction<WH343> shall be ready<WH3559> at his side.<WH6763>
It shall devour<WH398> the strength<WH905> of his skin:<WH5785> even the firstborn<WH1060> of death<WH4194> shall devour<WH398> his strength.<WH905>
His confidence<WH4009> shall be rooted out<WH5423> of his tabernacle,<WH4480> <WH168> and it shall bring<WH6805> him to the king<WH4428> of terrors.<WH1091>
It shall dwell<WH7931> in his tabernacle,<WH168> because it is none<WH4480> <WH1097> of his: brimstone<WH1614> shall be scattered<WH2219> upon<WH5921> his habitation.<WH5116>
His roots<WH8328> shall be dried up<WH3001> beneath,<WH4480> <WH8478> and above<WH4480> <WH4605> shall his branch<WH7105> be cut off.<WH5243>
His remembrance<WH2143> shall perish<WH6> from<WH4480> the earth,<WH776> and he shall have no<WH3808> name<WH8034> in<WH5921> the street.<WH6440> <WH2351>
He shall be driven<WH1920> from light<WH4480> <WH216> into<WH413> darkness,<WH2822> and chased<WH5074> out of the world.<WH4480> <WH8398>
He shall neither<WH3808> have son<WH5209> nor<WH3808> nephew<WH5220> among his people,<WH5971> nor<WH369> any remaining<WH8300> in his dwellings.<WH4033>
They that come after<WH314> him shall be astonished<WH8074> at<WH5921> his day,<WH3117> as they that went before<WH6931> were frightened.<WH8178>
Surely <WH389> such<WH428> are the dwellings<WH4908> of the wicked,<WH5767> and this<WH2088> is the place<WH4725> of him that knoweth<WH3045> not<WH3808> God.<WH410>
